How can I generate a random list of 10 superlative adjectives in Spanish that describe physical appearance using Ruby? Can you provide me with the Ruby code to generate this list and display it in an HTML page similar to the example given below? Additionally, please ensure that the adjectives have not appeared in any of the previous lists generated by this code. Please include comments in the Ruby code to explain the logic of how the adjectives were randomly generated. Random Adjectives in Spanish

Random Adjectives in Spanish

Here are ten random examples of superlative adjectives in Spanish that describe physical appearance:

  • Espectacular - Spectacular
  • Deslumbrante - Dazzling
  • Increíble - Incredible
  • Exquisito - Exquisite
  • Seductor - Seductive
  • Imponente - Impressive
  • Glamoroso - Glamorous
  • Majestuoso - Majestic
  • Suntuoso - Sumptuous
  • Elegante - Elegant

To generate a random list of 10 superlative adjectives in Spanish that describe physical appearance using Ruby, and ensure that the adjectives have not appeared in any of the previous lists, you can follow these steps: 1. Create a list of adjectives. 2. Randomly select adjectives from the list, ensuring they haven't been used in previous generations. 3. Store used adjectives to prevent repetition in future lists. 4. Generate an HTML page displaying the adjectives. Here's a Ruby script to achieve this: ```ruby # Define a module to handle storage of used adjectives module AdjectiveStore FILE_PATH = 'used_adjectives.txt' # Load previously used adjectives from a file def self.load_used_adjectives return [] unless File.exist?(FILE_PATH) File.read(FILE_PATH).split("\n") end # Save newly used adjectives to a file def self.save_used_adjectives(used_adjectives) File.open(FILE_PATH, 'w') do |file| file.puts(used_adjectives) end end end # List of superlative adjectives in Spanish adjectives = [ "Espectacular", "Deslumbrante", "Increíble", "Exquisito", "Seductor", "Imponente", "Glamoroso", "Majestuoso", "Suntuoso", "Elegante", "Radiante", "Magnífico", "Fascinante", "Hermoso", "Brillante", "Impresionante", "Deslumbrador", "Sublime", "Resplandeciente", "Fenomenal" ] # Load previously used adjectives used_adjectives = AdjectiveStore.load_used_adjectives # Select adjectives that haven't been used yet available_adjectives = adjectives - used_adjectives # Shuffle and select 10 random adjectives random_adjectives = available_adjectives.sample(10) # Append the newly selected adjectives to the used list used_adjectives.concat(random_adjectives) # Save the updated list of used adjectives AdjectiveStore.save_used_adjectives(used_adjectives) # Generate HTML content html_content = <<-HTML Random Adjectives in Spanish

Random Adjectives in Spanish

Here are ten random examples of superlative adjectives in Spanish that describe physical appearance:

    HTML # Add each adjective to the HTML list random_adjectives.each do |adjective| html_content += "
  • #{adjective} - #{translate_adjective(adjective)}
    • \n" end html_content += <<-HTML
HTML # Method to translate Spanish adjectives to English def translate_adjective(spanish_adjective) translations = { "Espectacular" => "Spectacular", "Deslumbrante" => "Dazzling", "Increíble" => "Incredible", "Exquisito" => "Exquisite", "Seductor" => "Seductive", "Imponente" => "Impressive", "Glamoroso" => "Glamorous", "Majestuoso" => "Majestic", "Suntuoso" => "Sumptuous", "Elegante" => "Elegant", "Radiante" => "Radiant", "Magnífico" => "Magnificent", "Fascinante" => "Fascinating", "Hermoso" => "Beautiful", "Brillante" => "Brilliant", "Impresionante" => "Impressive", "Deslumbrador" => "Dazzling", "Sublime" => "Sublime", "Resplandeciente" => "Resplendent", "Fenomenal" => "Phenomenal" } translations[spanish_adjective] end # Write the HTML content to a file File.write('adjectives.html', html_content) ``` ### Explanation: - **AdjectiveStore Module**: Manages storage of used adjectives to avoid repetition. - **Adjective List**: Contains a list of superlative adjectives in Spanish. - **Random Selection**: Selects 10 random adjectives that haven't been used before. - **HTML Generation**: Generates an HTML page with the selected adjectives and their translations. - **Translation Method**: Provides English translations for the Spanish adjectives. This script will generate an HTML file named `adjectives.html` with a list of adjectives, ensuring that each list is unique based on historical usage.
